meanings.definition: Put an end to; halt or stop.
meanings.sent1: She decided to kybosh the argument before it escalated.
meanings.sent2: The teacher had to kybosh the noisy chatter in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The referee had to kybosh the player's attempt to cheat.
meanings.sent4: The sudden rain kyboshed our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent5: The strict rules kybosh any chances of cheating in the game.

meanings.sent1: He managed to kybosh his homework just before bedtime.
meanings.sent2: The chef needed to kybosh the final touches on the dish.
meanings.sent3: The last piece of the puzzle kyboshed the whole picture.
meanings.sent4: The marathon runner kyboshed the race with a sprint to the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The artist carefully kyboshed the painting with a signature in the corner.

meanings.sent1: The hero was determined to kybosh the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent2: The team worked together to kybosh their opponents in the match.
meanings.sent3: The clever strategy kyboshed the enemy's defenses.
meanings.sent4: The underdog managed to kybosh the reigning champion in a surprising victory.
meanings.sent5: The detective finally kyboshed the criminal's elaborate scheme.
